wikipedia_page.main: William de Alburwyke was an English medieval singer, college fellow, and university chancellor.William de Alburwyke was chantor of York in northern England. He was also at Merton College, Oxford and a Doctor of Divinity. He was Principal of Broadgates Hall, which later became Pembroke College, Oxford. Between 1324 and 1326, he was Chancellor of the University of Oxford.
